mdl.eyetracking._calibration¶

@purpose: Allow mdl.eyetracking.Eyelink to initiate calibration/validation/drift correction.
@date: Created on Sat May 1 15:12:38 2019
@author: Semeon Risom
@email: semeon.risom@gmail.com
@url: https://semeon.io/d/mdl

Classes

Calibration(w, h, tracker, window) Initiate the mdl.eyetracking.Calibration module.
class mdl.eyetracking._calibration.Calibration(w, h, tracker, window)[source]¶

Bases: pylink.EyeLinkCustomDisplay

Initiate the mdl.eyetracking.Calibration module.

Parameters:

Screen width, height.

tracker : object

Eyelink tracker instance.

window : psychopy.visual.Window

PsychoPy window instance.

__init__(w, h, tracker, window)[source]¶

Initiate the mdl.eyetracking.Calibration module.

Parameters:
w,h : int

Screen width, height.

tracker : object

Eyelink tracker instance.

window : psychopy.visual.Window

PsychoPy window instance.
setup_cal_display()[source]¶

Shows the ‘Camera Setup’ screen along with menu options.

Notes

This function is called to setup calibration/validation display. This will be called just before we enter into the calibration or validataion or drift correction mode. Any allocation per calibration or validation drift correction can be done here. Also, it is normal to clear the display in this call.

clear_cal_display()[source]¶

Clear the ‘Camera Setup’ screen along with menu options.

Exit the ‘Camera Setup’ screen along with menu options.

set_image_palette(r, g, b)[source]¶

Given a set of RGB colors, create a list of 24bit numbers representing the pallet. I.e., RGB of (1,64,127) would be saved as 82047, or the number 00000001 01000000 011111111
